Summary: Object leaving the atmosphere at very high velocity
trends: There have been 185 other sightings in Denver
There were no other sightings in Denver on or around September 25th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsAt approx. 6:45 PM I went outside to sit and look at the stars. I was looking toward the West when I saw what I thought was a very bright star so I went inside to get my binoculars. When I got back out (about 20 seconds later) I couldn't see the star anymore (which I thought was pretty strange) so I sat down in a lawn chair facing the East. I then saw a very bright light traveling South East and I focused my binoculars on it and saw two lights. I observed this object until it got to within about twenty degrees of the horizon when the lights started turning red and eventually disappeared. I would say the total time from when I started observing the object with the binoculars to when it disappeared was 30 seconds. I am a pilot and aircraft mechanic and saw no navigation lights on this object. It was traveling at a very high rate and I think that what I was observing was an exhaust from an object that was leaving the atmosphere.
